page.title: 14ENVIRONMENT OF SOUTH BENWELL
page.content: It was found that many of the people that lived in this area kept{dogs}not only for pets but to protect themselves from{burglary.}Some people said that they were frightened to open their doors to strangers.Many of the dogs are allowed to roam around the streets and there was dogs waste all over the pavements.{Litter}was also a problem and there were papers,cartons and plastic containers on the pavements and in the gardens.This may be due to the lack of litter bins in the area. Almost half of the people who were interviewed thought that{vandalism}was the main problem in the area. Empty houses had been vandalised and others had their windows boarded up. There was a great deal of grafitti on walls and bus shelters and many young people hang around the street corners.
